conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_A and I’m formally applying because Nursery_A is my first choice. I believe our family would be a great fit with your program, and we’re ready to accept a place if offered. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice, Nursery_A, immediately. Although Nursery_A ranks me 3rd (behind Parent_B and Parent_D), early application maximizes my chance if either higher-priority parent goes elsewhere. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment without overcommitting beyond the formal application.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application, Parent_A, and for sharing your strong interest in Nursery_A. After reviewing applications for this round, we’re not able to offer you a place at this time. We appreciate your consideration and wish you the best in your search.
conversation.thought: Parent_A is 3rd on Nursery_A’s true priority list (behind Parent_B and Parent_D). Since quota is 1, accepting Parent_A now would lock in a suboptimal match. Given Parent_B ranks Nursery_A 3rd and Parent_D ranks Nursery_A 2nd, there is a realistic chance one of them applies in later rounds depending on rejections elsewhere. Therefore, reject Parent_A now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_D. Nursery_C is my first-choice nursery and I would be very happy to accept a place if offered. I’m applying formally and can promptly provide any required documents or attend an interview at your convenience.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_D, thank you for your application and for placing Nursery_C as your first choice. We would be happy to offer you a place at Nursery_C. Please confirm your acceptance and we will share the next steps for documents and scheduling an interview/visit.

In this round I received [APPLY] from Parent_D and Parent_E; between them, Parent_D is ranked higher than Parent_E, so if I must choose now, Parent_D is the better match. However, Parent_C (my top choice) and Parent_B (second) have not applied yet; Parent_C ranks Nursery_C 4th and Parent_B ranks Nursery_C 5th, so they are unlikely to approach me early, while Parent_D ranks me 1st and is applying now. Given the one-shot accept/reject on an [APPLY] and quota 1, accepting Parent_D secures a relatively high-ranked candidate and avoids the risk of ending up with a lower-ranked match (or none) if I reject and my top choices never apply.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_C is my first choice, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your program. I’m ready to confirm immediately if offered a place and can complete any required steps promptly. Thank you for considering my application.

Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Therefore, we must reject Parent_E despite their strong interest and first-choice preference.
